LA Notes: ABAWD time limits apply; Louisiana has obtained area-based waivers for high-unemployment parishes. Standard 3-month limit within 36-month period for non-exempt ABAWDs.
Louisiana does NOT use BBCE. Standard federal SNAP income limits apply: 130% FPL gross income test AND 100% FPL net income test. Asset test also applies ($2,750 standard / $4,250 elderly-disabled).

Louisiana SNAP requires asset test (no BBCE). $2,750 resource limit standard; $4,250 for households with elderly or disabled member. Standard federal limits — Louisiana has not adopted higher thresholds.
Healthy Louisiana and LaCHIP cover lawfully present non-citizens after 5-year bar. Emergency Medicaid available regardless of immigration status. Louisiana expanded Medicaid in 2016 under ACA.
Healthy Louisiana (MAGI): 138% FPL adults 19-64, 138% FPL pregnant women, 217% FPL children 0-18. LaCHIP (separate CHIP): children up to 212% FPL. Louisiana expanded Medicaid effective July 2016.
Louisiana is a 1634 state: SSI recipients receive automatic Medicaid enrollment. SSI recipients do not need a separate Medicaid application.
Louisiana uses the federal 60-month look-back period for asset transfers in Medicaid Non-MAGI (long-term care). Transfer penalty divisor based on average private-pay nursing facility rate.
Louisiana Medicaid Buy-In Program for workers with disabilities: working individuals with disabilities may qualify for Medicaid with income up to 250% FPL. Must demonstrate current employment.
Must demonstrate current employment for Louisiana Medicaid Buy-In eligibility. Employment verification required at application and redetermination.

FITAP imposes a 24-month state time limit within any 60-month period — one of the shortest in the nation. Federal 60-month lifetime limit also applies. Hardship extensions available for up to 10% of caseload.
FITAP requires cooperation with child support enforcement. Good cause exemption available for domestic violence per Family Violence Option.
FITAP one-time diversion payment: lump-sum payment to resolve a short-term crisis as an alternative to ongoing FITAP enrollment. Receipt may affect future FITAP eligibility period.
LA LIHEAP uses 60% of state median income as income threshold. Program is primarily cooling-focused given Louisiana climate; includes crisis component for utility emergencies.

LA LIHEAP is primarily cooling-focused given the subtropical climate; summer cooling assistance is the primary benefit. Heating assistance available but secondary. Crisis component available year-round for utility emergencies.
Cooling assistance is the primary LIHEAP need in Louisiana due to subtropical climate. Summer cooling benefits typically larger than winter heating benefits.
Subsidized child care for working families and those in education/training. Income limits based on state median income. Administered by Louisiana Department of Education.
Monthly subsidy payments to relative caregivers of children who might otherwise be in foster care. Administered by Louisiana DCFS (Department of Children and Family Services).
Required for state-only programs; CCAP verifies child age eligibility (under 13, or under 18 with special needs); KCSP verifies child age (under 18)
Required for state-only programs
CCAP requires employment, participation in education/training, or FITAP work activity. Employment status determines child care subsidy authorization.
Income type required for all state-only programs
Income verification required for all state-only programs
Indicates need for child care assistance. Required for CCAP application. Must identify each child needing care and the type of care arrangement.
Verification that the caregiver is a relative of the child within the fifth degree of kinship per Louisiana Civil Code. Required for KCSP eligibility.
Louisiana has 64 parishes (not counties). Parish code identifies the administering local office. All state-administered programs require parish identification for case assignment and reporting.
CAFE (Common Access Front End) system case tracking number. Louisiana uses the CAFE integrated eligibility system for benefits administration across programs.
Verification of Louisiana residency required for all state-administered programs
CAFE (Common Access Front End) eligibility system client identifier; used across all Louisiana-administered programs

Added vietnamese|french_creole for significant Louisiana communities. Vietnamese community concentrated in southeastern Louisiana (New Orleans East, Gulf Coast). Louisiana Creole French (french_creole) reflects the state unique cultural heritage.
